page.title: 08VILLAGE CRAFTS
page.content: A century ago you could have found a harness maker,a blachsmith,and a clog and patten maker in all our Wealden villages. Today there is indeed a blacksmith, though he intends to retire at 30, so he hasn't got much time left.He can do hot or cold shoeing,brazing,welding and ornamental metalwork.A lady in Bodle Street makes soft toys and sells them from her cottage.A man at the north end of the village makes garden ornaments out of broken tiles and cement - urns,plant pots and sundials.There is also an artist in Bodle Street who, on occasions, exhibits and sells his paintings. Most of our creativity as a village seems to go into our gardens, and Back Lane in Bodle Street is as pretty a street of cottage gardens as you could find anywhere.
